DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether reducing inflammation in blood vessels with an aspirin-like drug called salsalate will improve blood vessel function.
DOC.brief_title: Inflammation and Vascular Function in Atherosclerosis
DOC.detailed_description: To test the hypothesis that inhibition of I [kappa] B kinase [beta] (IĸKβ), an inflammatory mediator, by high dose salsalate, will restore insulin-mediated endothelium-dependent vasodilation in subjects with atherosclerosis.
DOC.criteria: Nonsmoking adult subjects with known atherosclerosis Uncontrolled hypertension (> 140/90 mmHg) Untreated hypercholesterolemia (LDL > 160 mg/dL) Diabetes mellitus Alanine Aminotransferase > 150 Creatinine > 1.4 mg/dL Concommitant use of warfarin
